This Coordinator would be an educator of recognised standing. Although
he would be appointed by the MAEB Board and would be responsible to the
Board through die Executive Director, suggestions for candidates for this
limited term appointment would be sought from various organisations and
individuals outside the NAEB as well, notably from institutions scheduled to
cooperate with the MAEB in this project. It is felt that a qualified individual
of the type needed for such an important development could not be secured
for a limited-term appointment for less than the sum mentioned here,
Necessary qualifications for this individual will become clearer as we
list his functions • This coordinator will:
1) Coordinate the work of consultants secured to develop individual
membership qualifications in the NAEB, as a working committee,
2) Plan and implement the teacher-training program outlined and yet to
be finalized, including workshops, conferences and meetings as
listed below. This also includes die handling of relations with co¬
operating institutions and individuals, and the adequate reporting
thereof.
3) With the chairmen of appropriate NAEB Committees {Professional
Advancement, Utilization, Membership, and others) develop an inten¬
sive program for the development of the esprit de corps on which pro¬
fessionalism must rest, and initiate new member services in this area.
4) Travel as necessary for the supervision of consultants and regional
meetings — and for representing the NAEB, as designated and invited,
